ground_truth: Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue, are screaming in rage, fear, and incomprehension as blue dollar bills snap and flutter around the inside of the car. The car is swerving wildly as Gale drives blind, with the inside of the windshield covered with blue paint. He reaches forward to wipe clear a patch of windshield, and as the blue paint is smeared away, we see Hi and Ed's car parked broadside in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are in front of it, with Hi aiming his scatter gun and Ed a revolver. Ed runs over to Gale and Evelle's car, throws open the back door to look for the baby, but comes out only with Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Evelle is staggering around in shock, looking in disbelief at his own blue body. Hi and Ed climb into their car and peel out. Sitting placidly in his car seat in the middle of the road in front of a bank is Nathan Jr. As the camera focuses on Nathan Jr., it booms up to show the empty street beyond him while the crack of return fire and furiously squealing brakes are heard, culminating in a loud explosion that snaps off the siren wail. The police car is apparently history, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a ball of flame has leapt up with the explosion. As the explosion echoes and fades, the deep rumble of an approaching engine is heard, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears over the rise. Framed against fire and smoke, he is coming directly toward us and the baby. As they top a rise from the other direction, we see the baby sitting in the middle of the street, with Lenny fast approaching from the background. The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a clank of chains, Lenny's hand drops down into frame, palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we are almost upon. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along, Lenny hooks the car seat over his handlebars. Approaching, Lenny saws a shotgun out of his back holster and levels it at the oncoming car, sighting down the gun and swinging it around as he approaches the car. The shotgun spits orange flame, and the windshield explodes in as Lenny roars by, with the baby on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn, shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both enveloped in azure, are shrieking in fury, dread, and perplexity as azure dollar bills crack and flit around the interior of the vehicle. The vehicle is veering erratically as Gale steers blinded, with the interior of the windshield coated with azure pigment. He stretches forward to cleanse clear a patch of windshield, and as the azure pigment is smeared away, we observe Hi and Ed's vehicle stationed broadside in the center of the road. Hi and Ed are in front of it, with Hi aiming his scatter gun and Ed a revolver. Ed rushes over to Gale and Evelle's vehicle, flings open the rear door to search for the infant, but emerges only with Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Evelle is staggering around in shock, gazing in disbelief at his own azure body. Hi and Ed ascend into their vehicle and peel out. Sitting serenely in his car seat in the center of the road in front of a bank is Nathan Jr. As the camera concentrates on Nathan Jr., it booms up to reveal the vacant street beyond him while the crack of retaliatory fire and furiously screeching brakes are heard, culminating in a loud detonation that snaps off the siren wail. The police vehicle is evidently history, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a ball of flame has leapt up with the detonation. As the detonation reverberates and diminishes, the deep rumble of an approaching engine is heard, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle emerges over the rise. Framed against fire and smoke, he is coming directly toward us and the infant. As they top a rise from the opposite direction, we observe the infant sitting in the center of the street, with Lenny rapidly approaching from the background. The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a clank of chains, Lenny's hand descends into frame, palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we are almost upon. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along, Lenny hooks the car seat over his handlebars. Approaching, Lenny extracts a shotgun out of his back holster and levels it at the oncoming vehicle, sighting down the gun and swinging it around as he approaches the vehicle. The shotgun spits orange flame, and the windshield detonates in as Lenny roars by, with the infant on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn, shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the vehicle rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue, are being screamed at in rage, fear, and incomprehension by blue dollar bills snapping and fluttering around the inside of the car. The car is being swerved wildly as it is driven blindly by Gale, with the windshield inside covered with blue paint. A patch of windshield is wiped clear by him reaching forward, and as the blue paint is smeared away, Hi and Ed's car is seen parked broadside in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are in front of it, with a scatter gun aimed by Hi and a revolver by Ed. Ed runs over to Gale and Evelle's car, opens the back door to look for the baby, but only Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care is brought out by him. Evelle is staggered around in shock, as he looks in disbelief at his own blue body. Their car is climbed into by Hi and Ed, and they peel out. Nathan Jr. is sitting placidly in his car seat in the middle of the road in front of a bank. As Nathan Jr. is focused on by the camera, it booms up to show the empty street beyond him while the crack of return fire and furiously squealing brakes are heard, culminating in a loud explosion that snaps off the siren wail. Apparently, history is made by the police car, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a ball of flame leaps up with the explosion. As the explosion echoes and fades, the rumble of an approaching engine is heard deeply, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears over the rise. Framed against fire and smoke, directly toward us and the baby he is coming. The baby is seen sitting in the middle of the street as Lenny tops a rise from the other direction, fast approaching from the background. The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat being rushed toward by us. With a clank of chains, a hand of Lenny drops down into the frame, palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we are almost upon. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along, the car seat is hooked over Lenny's handlebars. Approaching, a shotgun is sawed out of his back holster by Lenny and leveled at the oncoming car, sighting down the gun and swinging it around as he approaches. Orange flame is spat by the shotgun, and the windshield explodes in as Lenny roars by, with the baby on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike is banked into a hard turn, shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car is rocked to a halt.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue, scream in rage and fear as blue dollar bills flutter inside the car. The car swerves wildly as Gale drives blind, the windshield smeared with blue paint. He clears a patch to see Hi and Ed's car parked in the road. Hi aims a scatter gun, and Ed a revolver. Ed checks Gale and Evelle's car for the baby but finds only Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Evelle staggers in shock, staring at his blue body. Hi and Ed drive off. Nathan Jr. sits calmly in his car seat in front of a bank. The camera shows the empty street as return fire and squealing brakes end in an explosion, silencing the siren. A ball of flame rises, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears, framed by fire and smoke, heading toward the baby. Lenny's hand reaches down to scoop up Nathan Jr. as he speeds by, hooking the car seat over his handlebars. Lenny draws a shotgun, firing at an oncoming car, shattering its windshield. The bike banks hard, shooting through the empty windshield space as the car halts.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, covered in blue, scream in rage and fear as blue dollar bills flutter inside the swerving car. Gale drives blind, wiping the blue-painted windshield to see Hi and Ed's car parked ahead. Hi aims a scatter gun, Ed a revolver. Ed checks Gale's car for the baby but finds only Dr. Spock's book. Evelle, in shock, stares at his blue body. Hi and Ed drive off. Nathan Jr. sits in his car seat on the road. The camera shows the empty street as return fire and squealing brakes end in an explosion, silencing a siren. A police car is destroyed, and flames rise. Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears, heading toward the baby. The low shot shows Lenny's hand scooping up Nathan Jr. as he speeds by, hooking the car seat on his handlebars. Lenny draws a shotgun, firing at an oncoming car, shattering its windshield. The bike turns sharply, shooting through the windshield's space, as the car halts.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both enveloped in a striking shade of blue, are vociferously screaming in a tumultuous mix of rage, fear, and utter incomprehension. All around the interior of the car, blue dollar bills are snapping and fluttering wildly, creating a chaotic scene. The car itself is swerving erratically, as Gale, who is driving, is essentially blind due to the windshield being completely covered with blue paint. In a desperate attempt to see, he reaches forward to wipe clear a small patch of the windshield. As the blue paint is smeared away, a clearer view reveals Hi and Ed's car, which is parked broadside right in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are positioned in front of it, with Hi aiming his scatter gun and Ed holding a revolver. Ed quickly runs over to Gale and Evelle's car, throws open the back door in a frantic search for the baby, but emerges only with a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Meanwhile, Evelle is staggering around in a state of shock, staring in disbelief at his own blue-painted body. Hi and Ed then climb back into their car and speed away. Sitting calmly in his car seat, right in the middle of the road in front of a bank, is Nathan Jr. As the camera focuses intently on Nathan Jr., it booms upward to reveal the empty street stretching out beyond him. The crack of return fire and the sound of furiously squealing brakes fill the air, culminating in a loud explosion that abruptly cuts off the wailing siren. The police car is apparently no more, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a ball of flame has erupted with the explosion. As the echoes of the explosion fade away, the deep rumble of an approaching engine becomes audible, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears over the rise. Framed dramatically against the backdrop of fire and smoke, he is coming directly toward us and the baby. As they top a rise from the opposite direction, we see the baby sitting innocently in the middle of the street, with Lenny fast approaching from the background. The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a clank of chains, Lenny's hand drops down into the frame, palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we are almost upon. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is scooped up and out of the frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along, Lenny hooks the car seat securely over his handlebars. As he approaches, Lenny deftly saws a shotgun out of his back holster and levels it at the oncoming car, sighting down the gun and swinging it around as he draws near. The shotgun spits a burst of orange flame, and the windshield explodes inward as Lenny roars by, with the baby on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn, shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both clad in an eye-catching, vibrant shade of blue, find themselves vociferously screaming, their voices rising in a cacophonous blend of anger, fear, and sheer bewilderment. The inside of the vehicle is a maelstrom, with blue dollar bills snapping and fluttering wildly in the air, adding to the chaotic scene. The car itself is lurching and swerving unpredictably because Gale, who is at the wheel, is almost entirely blind due to the windshield being thoroughly obscured by blue paint. In a frantic and desperate bid to regain some semblance of vision, he extends his hand forward, wiping at the windshield in an attempt to clear a small section. As the blue paint smears away, a clearer picture emerges, revealing Hi and Ed's vehicle positioned broadside, directly in the middle of the road. Hi stands in front, aiming a scatter gun, while Ed is armed with a revolver. In a quick and urgent motion, Ed dashes over to the car occupied by Gale and Evelle, hastily flinging open the back door in a frenzied search for the baby. However, he finds only a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Meanwhile, Evelle stumbles around in a state of shock, staring at his own body, painted blue, in disbelief. Hi and Ed quickly retreat back to their vehicle and drive away with urgency. Sitting unperturbed in his car seat, positioned right in the center of the road in front of a bank, is Nathan Jr. The camera then focuses on Nathan Jr., slowly booming upward to reveal the deserted street stretching endlessly beyond him. The sharp crack of return fire and the high-pitched sound of furiously squealing brakes pierce the air, culminating in a loud explosion that abruptly silences the wailing siren, indicating that the police car has been obliterated. Beyond the crest of the road ahead, a fiery ball has erupted, marking the explosion's impact. As the echoes of this explosion gradually fade, the deep rumble of an engine approaching becomes audible, signaling the arrival of Lenny Smalls on his motorcycle. Framed against the dramatic backdrop of fire and smoke, he is advancing directly toward both us and the baby. As they crest a rise from the opposite direction, we catch sight of the baby sitting innocently in the middle of the street, with Lenny approaching rapidly in the background. The extremely low, wide shot, locked onto the speeding bike, gives us the perspective of rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a metallic clank of chains, Lenny's hand enters the frame, palm forward, ready to scoop up the car seat as it becomes increasingly near. In a low shot where Nathan Jr. is in the foreground, he is swiftly scooped up and out of the frame as Lenny speeds by. Roaring along, Lenny securely hooks the car seat over his handlebars. As he closes in, Lenny skillfully draws a shotgun from his back holster, leveling it at the oncoming vehicle, aiming down the gun and sweeping it around as he approaches. The shotgun erupts with a flash of orange flame, and the car's windshield shatters inward as Lenny races past, with the baby prominently on the handlebars and the road blurring by beyond him. His bike banks sharply into a hard turn, shooting through the space where the windshield once was, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both enveloped in a layer of blue paint, are vocally expressing a mix of rage, fear, and confusion, their voices rising above the chaos as blue dollar bills snap and flutter chaotically around the interior of the car. The vehicle is careening erratically from side to side, with Gale at the wheel, driving blindly due to the windshield being completely obscured by a thick coat of blue paint. In a desperate attempt to regain visibility, Gale stretches forward, his hand reaching out to wipe away a section of the windshield, smearing the blue paint aside. As the smeared paint clears, the scene outside becomes visible, revealing Hi and Ed's car parked sideways in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed stand in front of their vehicle, Hi poised with a scatter gun and Ed holding a revolver, ready for confrontation. Ed quickly moves towards Gale and Evelle's car, hastily opening the back door in search of the baby, but emerges only with a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care in hand. Meanwhile, Evelle is stumbling around in a state of shock, his eyes wide with disbelief as he stares at his own paint-covered blue body. Hi and Ed swiftly climb back into their car and speed away from the scene. In the middle of the road, sitting calmly in his car seat in front of a bank, is Nathan Jr. The camera focuses on Nathan Jr., then gradually moves upward to reveal the empty street stretching beyond him. The air is filled with the sharp crack of return fire and the screeching of brakes, culminating in a loud explosion that abruptly silences the wailing siren. The police car is seemingly obliterated, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a fiery ball of flame erupts with the explosion. As the sound of the explosion reverberates and fades, the deep rumble of an approaching engine becomes audible, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle emerges over the rise. Framed dramatically against the backdrop of fire and smoke, Lenny is heading directly toward us and the baby. From the opposite direction, as they crest a rise, the baby remains seated in the middle of the street, with Lenny rapidly closing in from the background. The camera captures an extremely low wide shot, locked onto the speeding motorcycle, showing us hurtling toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a clank of chains, Lenny's hand drops into the frame, palm forward, tensing in preparation to scoop up the car seat as the motorcycle nears. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is swiftly lifted out of the frame as Lenny speeds past. Continuing his rapid pace, Lenny hooks the car seat securely over his handlebars. As he approaches, Lenny draws a shotgun from his back holster, leveling it at the oncoming car, sighting down the barrel and swinging it around as he nears the vehicle. The shotgun discharges with a burst of orange flame, shattering the windshield as Lenny roars past, the baby perched on the handlebars in the foreground, with the road blurring by beyond him. The motorcycle banks sharply into a hard turn, shooting through the space where the windshield once was, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue, are frantically screaming as blue dollar bills flutter around inside their wildly swerving car. Gale, driving blind due to the paint-covered windshield, wipes a patch clear and spots Hi and Ed's car parked broadside in the road, with Hi aiming a scatter gun and Ed a revolver. Ed rushes to their car, checks for the baby, but finds only Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care book. Meanwhile, Evelle staggers in shock, staring at his blue-painted body. Hi and Ed quickly drive away. Nathan Jr. sits calmly in his car seat in the road, as the camera pans up to reveal an empty street. The sound of gunfire and screeching brakes culminates in a loud explosion, silencing a police siren. A ball of flame rises beyond the road's crest, signaling the police car's destruction. As the explosion fades, Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears, framed against the fire and smoke, heading directly toward Nathan Jr. The camera, locked onto the speeding bike, shows Lenny's hand reaching down to scoop up the car seat. In a swift motion, Lenny grabs Nathan Jr. and hooks the car seat over his handlebars. As he approaches an oncoming car, Lenny draws a shotgun, fires, and shatters the windshield while speeding past. The bike banks sharply, cutting through the space where the windshield was, as the car skids to a halt.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue due to an unexpected mishap with industrial-strength dye, are screaming in rage, fear, and incomprehension as blue dollar bills, part of a bank's anti-theft dye pack designed to mark stolen money, snap and flutter around the inside of the car. The car is swerving wildly as Gale drives blind, with the inside of the windshield covered with blue paint from a previous collision with a paint truck. He reaches forward to wipe clear a patch of windshield, and as the blue paint is smeared away, we see Hi and Ed's car, a vintage model notorious for its speed and durability, parked broadside in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are in front of it, with Hi aiming his scatter gun, a type of shotgun favored for its wide spread, and Ed a revolver, a classic six-shooter often used for its reliability. Ed runs over to Gale and Evelle's car, throws open the back door to look for the baby, but comes out only with Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care, a best-selling parenting book that has influenced generations of parents worldwide. Evelle is staggering around in shock, looking in disbelief at his own blue body, reminiscent of characters in comics when they meet unexpected transformations. Hi and Ed climb into their car and peel out. Sitting placidly in his car seat in the middle of the road in front of a bank is Nathan Jr., who remains blissfully unaware of the chaos surrounding him. As the camera focuses on Nathan Jr., it booms up to show the empty street beyond him while the crack of return fire and furiously squealing brakes are heard, culminating in a loud explosion that snaps off the siren wail, indicating the intense heat of the moment. The police car is apparently history, consumed by flames that now mark it as a casualty of the chaos, and beyond the crest of the road ahead, a ball of flame has leapt up with the explosion, reminiscent of dramatic film scenes that often depict catastrophe with such vivid imagery. As the explosion echoes and fades, the deep rumble of an approaching engine is heard, and Lenny Smalls' motorcycle, a powerful machine revered for its speed and handling, appears over the rise. Framed against fire and smoke, he is coming directly toward us and the baby, creating a scene akin to a modern Western showdown. As they top a rise from the other direction, we see the baby sitting in the middle of the street, with Lenny fast approaching from the background. The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr.'s car seat. With a clank of chains, reminiscent of a cowboy's lasso, Lenny's hand drops down into frame, palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we are almost upon. In a low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground, he is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along, Lenny hooks the car seat over his handlebars, a dangerous but daring maneuver. Approaching, Lenny saws a shotgun out of his back holster and levels it at the oncoming car, sighting down the gun with the practiced precision of a marksman, and swinging it around as he approaches the car. The shotgun spits orange flame, a vivid display of raw power and aggression, and the windshield explodes in as Lenny roars by, with the baby on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn, shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt, leaving a trail of chaos in its wake.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle both covered in blue are screaming in rage fear and incomprehension as blue dollar bills snap and flutter around the inside of the car. The car is swerving wildly as Gale drives blind with the inside of the windshield covered with blue paint. He reaches forward to wipe clear a patch of windshield and as the blue paint is smeared away we see Hi and Ed's car parked broadside in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are in front of it with Hi aiming his scatter gun and Ed a revolver. Ed runs over to Gale and Evelle's car throws open the back door to look for the baby but comes out only with Dr Spock's Baby and Child Care. In a low shot with Nathan Jr in the foreground he is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by. Roaring along Lenny hooks the car seat over his handlebars. Approaching Lenny saws a shotgun out of his back holster and levels it at the oncoming car sighting down the gun and swinging it around as he approaches the car. The shotgun spits orange flame and the windshield explodes in as Lenny roars by with the baby on the handlebars in the foreground and the road rushing by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn shooting through where the windshield used to be cutting in at the end of the skid. as the car rocks to a halt.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jasper and Marvin, both drenched in yellow, are giggling in joy, curiosity, and delight as yellow confetti sprinkles and dances around the inside of the spaceship. The spaceship is gliding smoothly as Jasper pilots calmly, with the inside of the porthole painted with yellow frosting. He leans backward to polish clean a section of the porthole, and as the yellow frosting is smeared away, we glimpse Zoe and Max's spaceship hovering diagonally in the center of the ocean. Zoe and Max are on top of it, with Zoe juggling her lasso and Max a harmonica. Max jumps over to Jasper and Marvin's spaceship, slides open the side hatch to search for the puppy, but emerges only with Mandelbrot's Fractals and Chaos. Marvin is frolicking around in wonder, inspecting with fascination at his own yellow skin. Zoe and Max climb onto their spaceship and zoom away. Sitting serenely in his highchair in the center of the desert in front of a library is Billy Jr. As the lens focuses on Billy Jr., it dolly zooms up to show the bustling avenue beyond him while the blast of departing echoes and cheerfully honking trombones are heard, culminating in a vibrant burst that pops off the horn melody. The tow truck is apparently retired, and beyond the summit of the mountain ahead, a bouquet of colors has soared up with the burst. As the burst reverberates and dissipates, the soft hum of an arriving bicycle is heard, and Benny Larges' moped rolls over the ridge. Framed against ribbons and cotton candy, he is traveling directly toward us and the cat. As they crest a hill from the opposite side, we see the kitten sitting in the center of the boulevard, with Benny rapidly nearing from the horizon. The extremely high narrow shot, coupled to the zooming moped, shows us gliding toward the underside of Billy Jr.'s highchair. With a rattle of bracelets, Benny's foot extends into view, toes forward, preparing to scoop up the highchair that we are nearly upon. In a high shot with Billy Jr. in the background, he is lifted up and out of view as Benny speeds by. Traversing along, Benny hooks the highchair over his shopping cart. Approaching, Benny unsheathes a telescope from his side basket and aims it at the advancing van, peering through the lens and swinging it around as he nears the van. The telescope shoots blue beams, and the porthole detonates out as Benny cruises by, with the kitten on the shopping cart in the background and the meadow flying by around him. The moped swings into a gentle curve, floating through where the porthole was, drifting in at the finale of the drift as the van slides to a stop.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Gale and Evelle, covered in blue paint, are in a frenzy as blue dollar bills swirl inside their car. Gale, struggling to see, wipes the windshield to reveal Hi and Ed's car blocking the road. Hi, with a scatter gun, and Ed, with a revolver, confront them. Ed searches Gale's car but finds only a book. Evelle, shocked, stares at his blue body. Hi and Ed quickly escape. Nathan Jr. sits calmly in his car seat in the road, near a bank. The camera zooms out, showing an empty street as gunfire and an explosion occur, marking the end of a police chase. Lenny Smalls, on a motorcycle, approaches, framed by fire and smoke. He speeds toward Nathan Jr., and in a dramatic low shot, scoops up the baby in his car seat, hanging it from his handlebars. Lenny draws a shotgun, firing at the oncoming car as he races by, breaking its windshield. Lenny maneuvers his bike skillfully into a hard turn, leaving chaos in his wake.
